channel.title: Old Rune-Server Official Server and Shard Evolution client
channel.description:
This is mostly my work and the parts that i didn't write were under a FOSS license so i'm free to release this.
This was the client for Shard Evolution and later on the Rune-Server Official Server, it represents all of my work from February '07 to June '10.
The code is pretty messy and it's instable as hell but it contains a lot of features never before added to a RuneScape 2 #317 client, some of them have never been done by anyone else at all!
I reccommend people to study the code or carefully port it but i do not reccommend using this client because of the instability.
I did not include data files because the client probably won't run anyway, so if you came here hoping to find the most EPIC H4X0R client ever that you could just LEECH : GTFO my thread.
The interface engine of this client is almost as advanced as the one found in new engine clients
[SIZE="5"]Features (probably an incomplete list):[/SIZE]
[ul][*]New engine sprite loading [*]Interface scripting [*]Interface based gameframe [*]Interface based loginscreen [*]Real welcome screen 100% working [*]#508 Object definition format loading [*]#508 Floor definition loading [*]Working update server client [*]Partial #508 cache loading [*]Partial OpenGL based HD renderer [*]Textured underlays [*]Textured shaped tiles [*]Animated loginscreen (You'd need the cache for this as it is an interface, but most of the logic and edits we're done in the engine [*]Video cutscenes [*]Voice acted dialogue support[/ul]
[SIZE="5"]Related show-off threads:[/SIZE] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/197404-ultra-refactoredness-shardevo-client.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/197404-ultra-refactoredness-shardevo-client.html[/url] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/124052-hd-maps-objectdef-317-loaded-508-format-data-files.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/124052-hd-maps-objectdef-317-loaded-508-format-data-files.html[/url] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/127433-shard-evoloutions-client-peter.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/127433-shard-evoloutions-client-peter.html[/url] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/125347-shard-evolution-client-progress.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/show-off/125347-shard-evolution-client-progress.html[/url] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rsps-competitions/archived-competitions/218111-welcome-screen.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rsps-competitions/archived-competitions/218111-welcome-screen.html[/url] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rsps-competitions/archived-competitions/239020-video-cutscenes.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rsps-competitions/archived-competitions/239020-video-cutscenes.html[/url] [url=http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rsps-competitions/archived-competitions/205531-first-pictures.html]http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rsps-competitions/archived-competitions/205531-first-pictures.html[/url] (NOT ALL ARE ON THIS CLIENT)
[SIZE="5"]Download:[/SIZE] [url=http://uppit.com/z4umgghdj0nq/Build_317_(Peterbjornx,Rune-Server_and_ShardEvolution).rar]Download Build.317.(Peterbjornx,Rune.Server.and.Shard.Evolution).rar @ UppIT[/url]

Native^:

@RandQm Yes, but still, this is a good post. Someone worked hard on this. And everybody is ignoring it.

people don’t care about how much work is done, it has to be ready to leech

item.title: Old Rune-Server Official Server and Shard Evolution client
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Loveandpower:

it’s a nice release and unique at that but I don’t see this being used by the majority of people.

I reccommend people to study the code or carefully port it but i do not reccommend using this client because of the instability.

The code is pretty messy and it’s instable as hell

I did not include data files because the client probably won’t run anyway, so if you came here hoping to find the most EPIC H4X0R client ever that you could just LEECH : GTFO my thread.

I don’t think he meant it to be widely used… But to be used as more of a reference…

Read full topic

item.title: Old Rune-Server Official Server and Shard Evolution client
item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

This is mostly my work and the parts that i didn’t write were under a FOSS license so i’m free to release this.

This was the client for Shard Evolution and later on the Rune-Server Official Server, it represents all of my work from February '07 to June '10.

The code is pretty messy and it’s instable as hell but it contains a lot of features never before added to a RuneScape 2 #317 client, some of them have never been done by anyone else at all!

I reccommend people to study the code or carefully port it but i do not reccommend using this client because of the instability.

I did not include data files because the client probably won’t run anyway, so if you came here hoping to find the most EPIC H4X0R client ever that you could just LEECH : GTFO my thread.

The interface engine of this client is almost as advanced as the one found in new engine clients

[SIZE=“5”]Features (probably an incomplete list):[/SIZE]

[ul][]New engine sprite loading
[]Interface scripting
[]Interface based gameframe
[]Interface based loginscreen
[]Real welcome screen 100% working
[]#508 Object definition format loading
[]#508 Floor definition loading
[]Working update server client
[]Partial #508 cache loading
[]Partial OpenGL based HD renderer
[]Textured underlays
[]Textured shaped tiles
[]Animated loginscreen (You’d need the cache for this as it is an interface, but most of the logic and edits we’re done in the engine
[]Video cutscenes
[*]Voice acted dialogue support[/ul]

[SIZE=“5”]Related show-off threads:[/SIZE]
